oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Parole for Pvt. Z. N. Williams
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Pvt. Z. N. Williams, Co. F, 22nd Tenn. Cav., CSA, listed as "Forrest's Army," of Humboldt, Tenn. signed this parole at the end of the war. The document described him as having light hair, blue eyes, a dark complexion, and being 5'8" tall. The parole was signed by Capt. O. D. Vaughn, Provost Marshal of the District of Western Kentucky. The 22nd Tenn. Cav. Regt., CSA operated in North Alabama in the early 1864. They joined Forrest's command for the Tennessee Campaign in September 1864.
